text: The Tudor architectural style is a mediaeval architectural style in England during the Tudor period (14851603). Tudor House, Chester is a good example of a wealthy merchant's house. Tudor House is constructed in sandstone, in brick, and in timber framing with plaster panels. It is roofed in slate. It has four storeys plus a cellar. It is a grade II* listed building on the National Heritage List for England. Category:Architectural styles
title: Tudor architecture
